results.title: Titanic (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Lightstorm Entertainment and Jon Landau
results.brief_description: This sweeping love story sailed into the hearts of moviegoers around the globe, ultimately emerging as the most popular motion picture of all time. Starring Leonardo Di Caprio and Kate Winslet as star-crossed lovers who find themselves on the maiden voyage of the “unsinkable” R.M.S. Titanic. When the doomed luxury liner strikes an iceberg in the frigid North Atlantic, their passionate love affair becomes a thrilling race for survival. Winner of eleven Academy Awards including Best Picture, this tale of forbidden love and courage in the face of disaster triumphs as a true cinematic masterpiece.

results.title: Titanic
results.brief_description: The Titanic carried 2208 passengers, 705 were saved, 1503 died. This film re-constructs the sinking of the boat and the terror of the passengers using drawings and old photographs. The horror of the disaster, the victims, the rescue and the safe arrival of survivors in port is linked by a song.

results.title: Tissues of the human body
results.brief_description: Compares the life processes of the one-celled organism with the human body. Uses animation to illustrate the variety of cell specialisation in humans. Presents in detail the organisation of the more important kinds of tissue; protective and secretive epithelium; connective tissues in skin, in tendon, and in bone; blood considered as a tissue; muscle tissue; and nerve tissue.

results.title: Tirra Lirra by the river [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project, Box Hill School of TAFE and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry, Elaine Barry and Greg Kratzman discuss Jessica Anderson novel, which is set in Brisbane. Explores the text’s connection with Tennyson’s poem; Nora’s exploration of her own experience; the role of masks and the place of minor characters.

results.title: Tirez Sur le Pianiste = Shoot the Piano Player (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Pierre Braunberger, Films de la Pleiade and Francois Truffaut
results.brief_description:
An ex-concert pianist, working in a seedy bar gets involved with gangsters when he helps his two petty crook brothers escape from them, an action culminating in the death of his girlfriend. This film, more than any other, reflects the influence of Hollywood low-budget melodramas on Truffaut and his cinematic style.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Francois Truffaut ; writers, Francois Truffaut, Marcel Moussy , photography, Raoul Coutard ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Charles Aznavour, Marie Dubois, Nicole Berger, Albert Remy, Michele Mercier, Daniel Boulanger, Alice Sapritch, Boby Lapointe.

results.title: Tires
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Yehuda Yaniv
results.brief_description: Observes tyre sculptor William Weisz as he recycles discarded tyres into dragons, elephants, and other creative shapes and structures. Traces this process from the original manufacture of the tyres to the installation of the sculptures as safe and durable playground equipment. Without narration.
results.description: Observes tyre sculptor William Weisz as he recycles discarded tyres into dragons, elephants, and other creative shapes and structures. Traces this process from the original manufacture of the tyres to the installation of the sculptures as safe and durable playground equipment. Without narration.

results.title: Tire wise
results.brief_description: Gives information about buying and using automobile tyres, including their manufacture, how the three main types of tyres differ, and how to get maximum tyre mileage and driving safety. Includes details on skids, chains, changing a tyre and hydroplaning.

results.title: Tips for teachers
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy Organization and United States. Navy
results.brief_description: Presents the three “P’s” of good teaching. Explains the place and value of the teacher’s “personality”; dramatises the importance of “preparation” and gives and example of how the “presentation” of the material is best accomplished. Analogies are introduced to show how the teacher must use showmanship, salesmanship and the ability of an actor to help shorten the learning process.

results.title: Tip of the iceberg
results.creator_credit: Steve Morrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
The problem of toxic industrial waste poses environmental problems around the world. This film investigates the dangers of the dumping of tons of toxic waste on an industrial tip near the Avon Age fortress of Sutton Walls, Hertfordshire, and near farmland in Matlock, Derbyshire.
